title: N’Golo Kante set to miss Chelsea’s clash against Newcastle United
text:
N’Golo Kante is unlikely to feature in Chelsea’s clash with Newcastle United (Getty Images)

N’Golo Kante is set to miss Chelsea’s clash against Newcastle United on Saturday, according to reports.

The 28-year-old was also forced to pull out of France’s Euro 2020 qualifier against Iceland last Friday after he suffered a groin injury in the warm-up.

France boss Didier Deschamps played down the severity of Kante’s injury, but the midfielder has already missed four games this season due to an ankle problem.

According to the Evening Standard, Frank Lampard is considering giving Kante a rest over the weekend as he wants him to be fully fit for his side’s Champions League clash against Ajax next Wednesday.

Kante injured his groin in the warm-up before France played Iceland on Friday (Getty Images)

The report claims that Kante is still being assessed by Chelsea’s medical team but ‘is unlikely to be risked’ for the game against Newcastle at Stamford Bridge.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Elsewhere, Andreas Christensen and Mateo Kovacic are both doubts after picking up injuries during the international break.

Emerson Palmieri has returned to training and is set to be in contention for next week’s match against Ajax.

Reece James is also in training after he pulled out of the England Under-21s squad last week.
